item.title: My Gaza is ready for peace. Hamas is trying to destroy it.
item.description: Trump’s ceasefire created two Gazas: one striving for a better future, the other ruled by fear.

item.title: Disarmament is needed for peace. It rarely goes well.
item.description: Armed factions resist relinquishing their weapons. Forcing them to do it can be deadly.

item.title: The U.S. plan to blow up drug boats has some major leaks
item.description: Military strikes on vessels in the Caribbean aren’t what could bring Venezuela a better future.

item.title: Utah Valley University faced a choice after Charlie Kirk’s killing
item.description: The school’s president sought to care for her community after the shocking assassination.

item.title: What the Louvre heist exposes about Macron’s France
item.description: The dazzling robbery shows the chaos, fragility and hubris defining French politics today.

item.title: Security surrealism
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on theft at the Louvre.

item.title: After 20 years of socialism, Bolivians say no MAS
item.description: The winner in Sunday’s presidential election ran on “capitalism for all.”

item.title: The scars of the Great Peanut Hysteria are finally fading
item.description: Allergy rates fell after pediatricians stopped telling parents to keep kids away from the nuts.

item.title: There’s a better way to help unrepresented patients
item.description: Readers respond to recent Post articles and commentary.

item.title: Why is the president still so beholden to Putin? I answered your questions.
item.description: David’s live chat with readers started at 12 p.m. ET on Monday. Read the transcript.

item.title: Eight years for a would-be assassin defies common sense
item.description: The sentence for Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh’s attempted killer is remarkably light.

item.title: I worked for Biden. Here’s the gold in Trump’s foreign policy.
item.description: The president leverages America’s power well and ignores domestic criticism.

item.title: These schools are the answer to unlocking every child’s potential
item.description: Children born into poverty should not be consigned to failing schools.

item.title: Trump keeps getting played by Putin. Will Budapest be different?
item.description: A Russia-Ukraine ceasefire might be possible if only Trump would apply more pressure on Putin.

item.title: Like the tea party of 2009, ‘No Kings’ protests are a warning to Trump
item.description: The GOP dismisses Saturday’s mass mobilization at its political peril.

item.title: The Gaza ceasefire is cracking. Hamas is to blame.
item.description: Terrorist brutality risks igniting a Palestinian civil war.
